availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William R. Mason (Judge of the Hancock County Court.)

body.p: A Virginia-born, Kentucky judge. Lived in Hawesville, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Elizabeth Henderson Mason. Owned nine enslaved persons in 1860. Served as sheriff of Hancock County in 1849. Served as judge of the Hancock County Court in 1861.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 134; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 11; Reports Communicated to Both Branches of the Legislature of Kentucky, at the December Session, 1849 (Frankfort, Ky.: A. G. Hodges & Co.â€“State Printers, 149), 162; "William R. Mason," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=89301020&ref=acom) (accessed on April 5, 2017); KYR-0002-022-0048.
